channel.title: Simba related questions?
channel.description:
Hi,
I was wondering if you guys and girls have any questions regarding Simba. The questions can vary from design, history of simba, future plans, possible features, etc. The reason I am asking this is because I'm wondering if there are any members on Mopar who would like to work with / on Simba. I know this forum is a bit java oriented [i][citation needed][/i], but any help is very welcome.
~Wizz

item.title: Simba related questions?
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

Hi,

[quote=“Plazan, post:41, topic:360654”]Missing functions:

  1. The most crucial functions that are missing for me to switch from Scar to Simba are the Client control functions:

procedure FindWindow(Title: string);

function FindWindowTitlePart(Title: string; CaseSensitive: Boolean): Boolean;

function FindWindowBySize(Width, Height: Integer): Boolean;

I use these functions to switch between client browser windows for several purposes. An example could be having two Google Chrome browser windows side by side where I then use FindWindowBySize to find the one I need and find the other one when it is needed etc…

If these functions won’t be implementet I (at least) can’t switch. I haven’t been able to find any functions in the Simba documentation that can replace those functions.[/quote]

There’s a bug open to have these added. It’ll be in eventually.

Plazan:

2. It would be really nice to have a form editor to make forms from scratch like the newest one in Scar DIVI 3.25 beta. This makes the working process much faster when designing a graphical userinterface.

It would probably make making forms easier. If you can find a Free Software Form Editor, we can add it. We’re not going to add or buy commercial crap like Freddy does. It doesn’t fit our ideology. If you really need this I suggest you use SCAR instead. I’ve personally never had any problems creating forms without the form editor, but I don’t use forms too much either. It’s quite useless in an interpreter language like pascalscript, IMO. No multithreading, and all the form stuff has to run on Simba’s main thread. Quite a pain to work with. (The same goes for SCAR)

Plazan:

3. It would be very nice if it was somehow possible to have several different browserwindows in one client handle. For example using the “SetDesktopAsClient” as client for three browserwindows side by side where it would be possible to search for bitmap pictures in each browser windows without activating it. Right now im getting dizzy seeing different browserclients pop op as they get activated and are searched for bitmaps. I don’t know if this is possible at all. If you have to click in the browser-client they will off-course be activated by nature but it would be nice and maybe also use less cpu power(?) to be able to search for bitmaps visible on the screen with only activating a parent client.

Simba has a (full blown) API to switch from different client targets. It can even seperate mouse and bitmap (windows, etc) targets. It just hasn’t seen much documentation love (and testing, I guess). http://wizzup.org/simbadoc/scriptref/window.html

Plazan:

4. . I hope the plans for library wrappers for different programming languages will be realized because I would really like those bitmap-functions implemented like a library in C++ or Java etc… That way you could make your own program independently of the Simba or Scar software and that would make life easier in several ways if you (as I do) plan to make an application from scratch.

They are still under way. There’s no one else working on them except me and I have a few side projects at the moment, but I’ll get it to eventually.

Read full topic

item.title: Simba related questions?
item.dc:creator: @Plazan Plazan
item.description:
@Plazan wrote:

abraham2119:

Again, that can all be done using the Windows API; I’m just not sure how easy it would be to integrate it along with your Simba scripts.

Well I would prefer these few functions getting implementing instead of having to mess with the Windows API. They have ported so many other functions so I would be rather surprised if it would be hard to implement.

I would be grateful to have those functions implemented.

Read full topic

item.title: Simba related questions?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

Again, that can all be done using the Windows API; I’m just not sure how easy it would be to integrate it along with your Simba scripts.

Read full topic

item.title: Simba related questions?
item.dc:creator: @Plazan Plazan
item.description:
@Plazan wrote:

Hmm…I have never used Windows API. Thanks for the link. Looked at it and got dizzy but I guess I might be able to figure it out. Anyway I still would prefer that the client-functions from scar i mentioned would be implemented in Simba.

What I meant with the 3 point was that I would like to be able to use the FindBitmap-functions in several browser windows without having to activate each single window each time i need to find a bitmap.

No matter what, I have to have several browser windows open at the same time because I search bitmaps on different websites so I cant just use one client window.

The problem is that every time I want to find a bitmap in the other browser window, than the one currently active I have to use the function “FindWindowBySize” and thereafter “ActivateClient”, to be able to find bitmap in the other browser window. If I dont activate the other browser window the function wont find any bitmaps at all because it still uses the handle for the first browser client.

It would be nice if the screen could be searched without having to activate each browser window every time, because what happens is that everything gets “locked” on the desktop and I get dizzy by seeing the browser windows blinking while getting activated several times a second. Thats why I wondered if it was possible to implement a client function dedicating a part of the screen as a parent client and then be able to search all browser windows put in the parent client.

Read full topic

item.title: Simba related questions?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

Plazan, if you are running Windows, you can just make use of the native win32 API. FindWindow(…) would probably suit you. I didn’t really understand your third point, but are you talking about getting windows other than the active window? You can easily do this too with the windows API using, as said above, FindWindow(…), EnumWindows(…), etc.

This might be helpful: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ff468919(v=VS.85).aspx

Read full topic

item.title: Simba related questions?
item.dc:creator: @Plazan Plazan
item.description:
@Plazan wrote:

Hi Simba people.

First of all. Congratulations with the software being official. I haven’t had the chance to test the program because Im missing some functionality that prevents me from testing it. I don’t play Runescape. I use Scar for another purpose.

Missing functions:

  1. The most crucial functions that are missing for me to switch from Scar to Simba are the Client control functions:

procedure FindWindow(Title: string);

function FindWindowTitlePart(Title: string; CaseSensitive: Boolean): Boolean;

function FindWindowBySize(Width, Height: Integer): Boolean;

I use these functions to switch between client browser windows for several purposes. An example could be having two Google Chrome browser windows side by side where I then use FindWindowBySize to find the one I need and find the other one when it is needed etc…

If these functions won’t be implementet I (at least) can’t switch. I haven’t been able to find any functions in the Simba documentation that can replace those functions.

  1. It would be really nice to have a form editor to make forms from scratch like the newest one in Scar DIVI 3.25 beta. This makes the working process much faster when designing a graphical userinterface.

  2. It would be very nice if it was somehow possible to have several different browserwindows in one client handle. For example using the “SetDesktopAsClient” as client for three browserwindows side by side where it would be possible to search for bitmap pictures in each browser windows without activating it. Right now im getting dizzy seeing different browserclients pop op as they get activated and are searched for bitmaps. I don’t know if this is possible at all. If you have to click in the browser-client they will off-course be activated by nature but it would be nice and maybe also use less cpu power(?) to be able to search for bitmaps visible on the screen with only activating a parent client.

  3. . I hope the plans for library wrappers for different programming languages will be realized because I would really like those bitmap-functions implemented like a library in C++ or Java etc… That way you could make your own program independently of the Simba or Scar software and that would make life easier in several ways if you (as I do) plan to make an application from scratch.

If this is done I will consider donating.

thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Simba related questions?
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

os_darwin is still missing for OS X. I think Markus (from SRL) managed to make Simba semi-compile using X11 and a slightly modified os_linux.pas.
It’ll also probably require some IFDEF’s to be changed. Initially we only imagined writing for Windows and Linux. So it’s usually {$IFDEF LINUX} {$ELSE} {$ENDIF}

Which will have to be IFDEF UNIX or POSIX, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Simba related questions?

item.description:

Read full topic

item.title: Simba related questions?
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

Well, the Mac side doesn’t get as much love as the Linux side, and certainly not as much as the Windows side.
The Linux and Windows side are both quite finished, but only Windows is functional. (The interpreter is a total bitch and only works on win32, although it claims to work on linux,mac and windows)

As soon as we have a decent interpreter and Linux works, Mac will get some more love too. The main problem is none of the developers actually have a mac.

Read full topic

item.title: Simba related questions?
item.dc:creator: @Blaqspade Blaqspade
item.description:
@Blaqspade wrote:

This sounds like an amazing project. I am personally really excited for the Mac release. It makes me happy that more programmers are coming to the Mac Side. I recently started learning C on my mac so I would be interested to poke around in the source once its available. Perhaps once my skills increase I could help out

Anyways my question is when is the mac version coming? ;D

And will be be in the form of an xcode project?

Or has none of this been decided yet…

Read full topic

item.title: Simba related questions?
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

Ok that is just odd. And I assume MoveMouse(0, 0); moved to the top of that window as well?
Also, if you start Simba from the terminal you can see when it is selecting a particular Window. (It will write some debug about trying to make it transparent + the XWindow ID; perhaps you can use that to see if it can select the flash app?

If you use compositing, Simba will try to make windows transparent if you’re hovering over them with the ``selector’’. I never got Firefox/TB to go transparent so that may be a XUL/X11 issue.

Anyway, if this doesn’t help debugging I can prepare a more debug friendly version.

And perhaps someone else can test the window selection as well? I really never had any problems with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Simba related questions?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Wizzup?, post:30, topic:360654”]Miss Silabsoft, could you try simply selecting the client and printing the size? Also, the status bars on Simba give your mouse position relative to the client. So if you move it in the client, it should be obvious whether it is selected or not. If it is selected, something weird may be going on.

What browser are you using?[/quote]
The size comes up correctly. I am using firefox but again i stated that all colors no matter what window I select even the Simba window is 0. Yeah something is wrong so I need a fix.

Read full topic

item.title: Simba related questions?
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

Miss Silabsoft, could you try simply selecting the client and printing the size? Also, the status bars on Simba give your mouse position relative to the client. So if you move it in the client, it should be obvious whether it is selected or not. If it is selected, something weird may be going on.

What browser are you using?

Read full topic

item.title: Simba related questions?
item.dc:creator: @Pouch Pouch
item.description:
@Pouch wrote:

Alright I made a basic script with a path for walking WITHOUT Reflection…

it dosent do anything just goes to the corner of my moniter, I even set the Client to the runescape client region…
Any fix?

Here’s my script (unfinished gonna release and post mroe once I get ahold of this simbaaaaa.)

[CODE]program plank;

var
w, h, x, y: integer;
begin
getclientdimensions(w,h);
MoveMouse(1750, 129);
getmousepos(x, y);
ClickMouse(1750, 129, mouse_Left);
Sleep(100);
MoveMouse(1863, 187);
getmousepos(x, y);
ClickMouse(1863, 187, mouse_Left);
MoveMouse(2057, 182);
getmousepos(x, y);
ClickMouse(2057, 182, mouse_Left);
MoveMouse(2016, 121);
getmousepos(x, y);
ClickMouse(2016, 121, mouse_Left);
MoveMouse(2007, 120);
getmousepos(x, y);
ClickMouse(2007, 120, mouse_Left);
MoveMouse(2022, 123);
getmousepos(x, y);
wait(200);
ClickMouse(2022, 123, mouse_Left);
MoveMouse(1589, 115);
getmousepos(x, y);
ClickMouse(1589, 115, mouse_Left);
ClickMouse(1589, 115, mouse_Right);
end. [/CODE]

Read full topic

item.title: Simba related questions?
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

Pouch:

Yes, I need walking methods and clicking methods…

SRL has an external library for Reflection. If you enable the Reflection Extension for Simba it’ll be auto installed. (Only Simba win32, extensions use interpreter and don’t work properly on linux yet)

Read full topic
